title: Audio becomes crackly after visiting some websites
content:
I am using Mozilla Firefox for Linux Mint, version mint-001 - 1.0, though I have had this same problem for many versions of Firefox on Linux on this particular computer. When visiting duolingo.com and doing the exercises, the sound is incredibly choppy, as if it is extremely low bitrate. What's more, this also corrupts the sound on other websites, for example, bandcamp.com. If I start up Firefox and visit bandcamp.com, the audio is fine, but once I visit duolingo.com it corrupts the sound on bandcamp.com and other sites until I restart Firefox. I suspect this is a driver issue. I have tried in troubleshooting mode, with a different profile etc.

title: Downloads Progress Box
content:
Hi

I'm guessing this is because of the latest update to Firefox, but every time a download finishes, the pop-up box for the downloads keeps coming up. I guess this is considered intuitive to let you know a download has finished, but I could do without it. I find it a bit distracting and it gets in the way. Is there a specific option that can disable it in the config?

Thanks
creator: DustyShinigami

title: Alterar opções de download/abrir arquivo
content: Saudações! Notei que a partir da última atualização do Firefox, quando um arquivo PDF é aberto no navegador, ao clicar no ícone "Baixar", não mais aparecem as opções "Abrir com" e "Salvar como", ou seja, já abre diretamente a janela "Salvar como" (imagem 1). Trabalho com leitura de arquivos em PDF que são baixados de um sistema próprio e por padrão deste sistema, ela abre previamente no leitor de PDF do Firefox. Logo após, estes arquivos PDF são analisados/lidos através programas específicos para PDF (Adobe, Foxit), mas não há a necessidade de que tais arquivos sejam salvos no computador, são somente temporários. Preciso também que seja mantida a opção de abrir arquivos PDF no Firefox (Configurações/Aplicativos), porque este sistema de onde eu baixo os arquivos PDF me dá uma prévia do que será baixado em um frame ao lado. Com essa nova mudança, eu tenho que salvar todos os arquivos no computador para só após abri-lo no Adobe Reader ou no Foxit. Gostaria, portanto, de saber se tem como voltar ou ativar as configurações anteriores ao clicar no ícone "Baixar", habilitando novamente a opção "Abrir com" (imagem 2). Grato!
creator: Mxr

title: Open bookmarks with bookmark I want at the top, at the top
content:
I am fine with the way Firefox allows me to order my bookmarks. I do NOT want my bookmarks to be ordered alphabetically, certainly not. But what I dislike is that Firefox insists that the bottom bookmark in my left bookmark column is something called "other bookmarks", and my bookmarks always open with that row bolded, so that my collection of "other bookmarks" occupies the entirety of the right column. This is not what I want. "Other bookmarks" are of no interest to me. I want the bookmark I have placed at the top of the left column, (the bookmark of maximum interest) to be where my bookmarks open. if I was writing a book, it would be the first chapter. I do not want my attention to be drawn to "other bookmarks" anywhere, I want to be rid of it, and if it cannot be got rid of, I do not want my bookmarks to open with that row bolded.

This comment is illustrated with an image of what is happening now whenever I open my bookmarks.
creator: matthewmontagupollock

title: Remove Application From Mailto List
content: Want to remove invalid application from Mailto options list. See attach. Please advise.
creator: big_slimm

title: latest version of firefox no longer asks to open specific file types.
content:
I do a lot of software troubleshooting where people send me files in discord that end in .cfg or .conf. Up until the latest release, firefox would let me just open them straight in my text editor instead of downloading them, but now it automatically opens the "download to" prompt without asking.

I haven't messed with any settings, and I can replicate the issue on 3 separate computers so I'm fairly certain it has something to do with the firefox update. Is there any workaround?
creator: cbc02009

title: 97.02 US-en, 64 bit SHA256 not correct
content:
I donlwoaded firefox 97.02 for US-en 64 bit from https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/all/#product-desktop-release and got 4 hashes that did not match Mozilla's official sha256 hash of 68c40b3f98c7d095cea5dbfd049dd2972e4d7a72758a5ec82d9a19e1f6e10865 obtained from https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/firefox/releases/97.0.2/SHA256SUMS

These incorrect hashes below are verified by Virustotal.com as belonging to Mozilla. I have installed one and it appears to be Firefox 97.02 US-en 64 bit. I placed this information on the r/firefox forum and it was closed.

Bad sha256 for firefox 97.02 us-en 64 bit

941d04335f3dc6ab575a4fed86bbe7a8799b4637d1b97dff5418ee82ff70aeda Firefox Setup 97.0.2(2).exe

8acf6daec77c14e10d65ce9650514ef99cb22bac6a865f483426dc330feb4f57 Firefox Setup 97.0.2 (3).exe

9908246c9cb54fe8c00dbef46a19def6cc453fb7f45b41bcf3662771ae6224f0 Firefox Setup 97.0.2.exe

42af39bf6de2f100ac3d5adb6861b2850fe49d6a5f4978545fc47aedb44c9669 Firefox Setup 97.02(4).exe

Virustotal.com can allow you to search the sha256 hashes above. Mozilla created the files but it is not listed in there sha256 official hash repository.
creator: sadiqowy

title: trunk/nightly crashing tabs on Linux if page contains video
content:
Firefox nightly (trunk) 100.0a1 (2022-03-10) (64-bit) (but previous version too) is crashing the tab if the page contains video content. It happens also in "Troubleshoot Mode". It doesn't happen in 98.0 (64-bit)

System is Kubuntu 21.10 with wayland and PipeWire
creator: randomizer

title: Downloads now pop up over browsing window - how to disable?
content: Since the latest update of Firefox, I now notice that each time I download anything the downloads icon in the toolbar expands the download history and remains in front of the browsing window until I click out of it. This behavior is reminiscent of the Chrome browser opening a pop-up bar every time I download anything which had to be manually closed — a regular irritant. I can see where some may prefer to have the pop ups, but I don't appreciate it becoming the default. Is there any way to disable this behavior so that it downloads in the background as it used to?
creator: wynden

title: Javascript seems to be broken on 98.0 mint-001 version
content:
I updated Linux Mint today, and everything else, including Firefox. Javascript seems to be at least partially broken. For example on reddit, the dropdown list of 'my subreddits' and links for post, edit, reply, voting, etc. all do nothing. On other sites where there should be dropdown lists, there's nothing there.

Turned off all add-ons. Same. Tried troubleshooting mode. Same. Still broken. Looked in the Mint forums and someone else was saying that they were having trouble with forms, so maybe related. But no solutions or things to try. Any ideas? Thanks.

creator: admin529

title: Most Recent Posts default
content: How can I change "Top Posts" default to "Most Recent"?
creator: barkerductions

title: Blank Pages in FF Post Upgrade
content:
I updated FF and now my bank (Capital One) just yields blank pages once I log in. Nothing displays. I tried troubleshooting mode to no avail. It happens with other legit web pages too. How do I fix this? They display fine in Edge. Open H264 Video Codec and Widevine are my only two plugins. I tried disabling the tracker to no avail either.

I'm running on a high performance Win 10 PC.
creator: WSC3

title: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/get-involved/kb#
content:
I don't understand the page in the subject. Is this marketing blurb? Can I click somewhere to offer help? I love to but Im rather stuck there.

Please be clear of intentions of every page. A basic UX principle.
creator: theking2

title: no synchronization from Android to desktop
content:
Firefox Sync does not work. None of the tabs I open on Android Firefox appear on the pc. No matter how often I click synchronize.

Is this by design or is synchronization not working from Android to Windows?
creator: theking2

title: Switch back to Outlook
content: I am not sure what i did, but a lot of my emails are not showing up, i had a bulk and spam folders but I somehow got rid of them. I can't get them back I guess and couldn't fix anything so I had to go back. I really liked your program too.
creator: MikeP15571

title: filtri
content: togliere un filtro o blocco di email
creator: drraffaelecaposiena

title: Macs will not stop syncing even though I've disabled sync on all of them.
content: I also have internet sharing turned off on the mac system preferences. What am I missing? Thank you!
creator: eclipse.editman

title: Search Engine
content: After installing Brave search engine, Firefox does not list the Brave search engine as a choice option in the settings search engine drop down. Why?
creator: grichardson

title: Speed Loading Problem
content: Hi, I'm using chrome since 2015, Recently I just Made my mind to shift from chrome to Firefox and I transferred all my accounts and login to all my gmails there and After that when I open any website like https://lewissfifthfloor.com this takes too much time to load and when i opened it on chrome its fast. Whats the main issue behind that? Can you please solve this for me?
creator: umairchouhdary77

title: Open tab next to current tab when middle clicking on a link
content: When you open a link to a new tab by middle clicking the mouse-wheel it opens the tab to the far right of the tab group. What I want it to do is to open just to the right of my current tab. Is this possible?
creator: kasperbb98

title: restore
content: I tried to update firefox. Something happened and I lost ALL settings. There is a .25 gb directory with a date/time of the crash called "0ssv68o0.Default User1". Can this be used to restore firefox?
creator: mdm.cit.43

title: Open downloaded wordprocessing file
content: I upgraded to version 98 on March 12, 2022 now on March 13, 2022 when I download a .docx file it no longer opens in WordPerfect as it did in version 97.0.2! Instead it asks to SAVE the file! That is NOT what I want to do! I want to open it without saving. I have spent a lot of time this morning trying to figure this out and getting no where.
creator: h.jane.brink

title: downloading update doesn't work
content: When I try to enter Kaspersky's 'Safe Money' to get to my bank... the message comes back to update Firefox Browser. I updated Firefox several times, but it still comes back to the same page to download the browser??? If your my browser, why can't I get into this one site? Need help!
creator: texas4ever

title: Slow download and upload speeds
content:
Good afternoon. My problem is that I am experiencing very slow (20% of normal) broadband speeds. This happens on a laptop bought in 2020 running Windows 10 when using Firefox via wifi. Speeds when browsing using Microsoft Edge on the same device and also via wifi are normal, which suggests the problem is not the network, my router or the wifi connection on the laptop in general. Also speeds connecting to the web using firefox via wifi using android devices are also normal. I have tried refreshing and then reinstalling Firefox on the laptop, which has made no difference. Has any kind person any solutions to suggest?

Thanks
creator: GeoffN

title: Hide recent downloads
content:
Recently there was a change how Firefox behaves regarding the recent downloads pop-up menu.

Up until 98.0 if I downloaded an item, the "Download" icon showed that there is a new downloaded item (it became "active", recolored to blue, so just like a nofiication icon), and If I clicked on the "Download" icon (down arrow), than it showed (a small pop-up below the download icon) the 3 recent items that were downloaded.

In 98.0 this was changed.

Now if I download an item, the recent downloaded pop-up list becomes active, and shows the recent items. So if I control the page with keyboard, I have to move back to the page, because now the keyboard input is controlling that small pop-up recent downloads.

If I download an item, just recolor/notify the download icon to blue showing that there is a new item, DON'T show me the recent downloads, and DON'T make that pop-up active, because I use mostly keyboard, and it is hard to control the page with keyboard presses, when that pop-up comes up.

I want the recent download pop-up functionality as it was before 98.0.

How do I change this behavior back? How do I turn off to NOT open the recent downloads pop-up automatically after each download?
creator: daihelyon

title: Firefox opens as a transparent window on Pop!_OS 21.10
content: This only happens with firefox, no other applications. It also only seems to happen on intel integrated graphics and not dedicated nvidia graphics
creator: alanmoir

title: SECURE CONNECTION FAILED ON FIREFOX WINDOWS 10
content: hi i use firefox on windows 10 for brosing websites. sometimes firefox go to error state and say: secure connection failed .this error further occure on www.google.com and other website like msn.com. donot have error on firefox. my firefox is updated my windows is updated .some setting on firefox in" about:config ," i changed them to fix the error but the problem not solved. changing setting like:security.insecure_field_warning.contextual.enabled chane to false and other setting i changed .your google crom browser do not have this problem and error on any websites.the google and other websites say that the error is about firefox new roles and systems and not related to google and other websites see attached file please help me tank you

creator: johnoo

title: Strange behavior in Firefox
content:
I am experiencing two critical problems with the latest version of Firefox 98.0

Every 1-2 hours the browser completely refuses to open any connection. It will not even open the local host 127.0.0.1 - The browser is functional, all of the buttons work. It just refuses to connect to anything.

Meanwhile Chrome, Vivaldi, Opera all open every webpage without a problem.

I first encountered this problem with the famous FoxStuck bug. After the bug was revealed and fixed the browser seemed to be working until now.

However since version 98.0 the problem seems to be back.

If I close the browser during these outages I can see several Firefox processes in the task manager. If I open Firefox again I am caught in an endless loop where it keeps saying Firefox is already running.

The only way to use the browser again is to either restart the computer, or shut down each process in the task manager.

Things I have tried to remedy this problem.

Windows System File Check Disabled all Firefox addons Re-installed the browser over ten times - Cleaned out the residual folders Tried the Firefox Extended Support Release builds Disabled all Firefox updates via the policies.json file Virus/Malware scans Tried various about:config switches

This happens on my work PC and on my home PC. I am using two different profiles on each one.

The weird thing is it is sometimes random. Sometimes it occurs once a day, sometimes it occurs multiple times in a day. The outages usually occur from between 2 - 5 minutes.

Tomorrow I will have to uninstall Firefox at work because I work in critical care for a health service. It's vital that we can access information seamlessly without a hitch. I've had to ask patients to wait 5 minutes due to this problem.

Is anyone else experiencing this problem? Is the infamous FoxStuck bug back again?
creator: reloadedx23

title: My microphone volume is low on Firefox
content: Everything works fine on my pc but for some reason when I try to use my microphone on any site (Like: WhatsApp voice notes, Telegram voice notes) my microphone volume is too low. I also tried to "Refresh Firefox" basically resetting it and it still didn't fix my problem. I would really appreciate it if you could help me fix this problem because I really love Firefox and love using it but this is a major problem for me... Thanks in advance

title: How to open files without downloading them after version 98
content:
Hello. I am extremely annoyed with Mozilla after this update and am DESPERATE for a fix.

I am a college student. I have to open several notes, lectures, syllabi, sample assignments, etc. a day. Obviously, I can't download every single one of these files to my computer. I'd run out of space. The SOLE REASON why I picked Firefox as my browser was because of the dialogue box that appeared whenever I went to download something, giving me the option to simply open a file without saving it.

They made it so that dialog box wasn't the default. Okay, fine, annoying. But all I have to do is go into settings and change it to "Always ask," right? Wrong. EVERY SINGLE FILE GETS DOWNLOADED TO MY COMPUTER NOW. Every PDF and MS Word document is sent straight to my download folder.

Is there ANY way I can open up files (specifically PDF and MS Word files) without saving them to my computer? I remember these files would be saved to a "temporary" file area, how can I re enable that again? If not, I will be switching to another browser that offers this option.
creator: beaunathanhoward

title: Some douche nerd always have to chime in that it's probably one of your add ons or extensions every time someone posts about a Firefox problem?
content: Why does some douche nerd always have to chime in that it's probably one of your add ons or extensions every time someone posts about a Firefox problem? Maybe Mozilla needs to check add ons more carefully before putting them in their repositories! Most cases have been some Firefox setting malfunction for most of my Firefox issues! It's a programmer flaw not extensions I use, especially since I haven't added any new ones in forever and only update them if they quit working! If it ain't broke don't fix it! Also Firefox needs to stop changing my settings to default on updates! I had my settings the way I did because I finally figured out how to get Firefox to run smoothy with audio/video and it isn't with the default settings for those. I am constantly having to untick use recommended performance settings and hardware acceleration. I also have to go through security and privacy settings and set them the way I like them and which cookies etc. Leave the settings the way I had them! Is there a way to export my settings to a file and when Mozilla f*cks it all up for me import them from that file? Please make unticked for email me when someone answers the thread. Thanks.
creator: nunya_fukkin_bizness
